ALDMethod.description: The method of ALD used, e.g., PEALD, Thermal ALD.

materialDeposited.description: The material that is deposited during the ALD process, e.g., HfS2, MoS2, SnS2, ZrS2, PbI2, CsI, CsPbI3, TaNx, Y2O3, Ti-Si-N, LiCoO2, Ga2O3.

lowerLimit.description: Lower temperature limit of the ALD process in Celsius.

upperLimit.description: Upper temperature limit of the ALD process in Celsius.

temperatureWindow.description: Temperature window for the ALD process where self-limiting growth is achieved.

name.description: The chemical name of the precursor.

bubblerTemperature.description: Temperature of the precursor bubbler in Celsius.

carrierGas.description: Type of carrier gas used with the precursor.

vaporPressure.description: Vapor pressure of the precursor in Torr.

precursorType.description: Type of precursor used, e.g., N-Heterocyclic carbene.

nonPyrophoric.description: Indicates whether the precursor is non-pyrophoric.

precursorSublimationTemperature.description: Sublimation temperature of the solid precursor in Celsius.

name.description: The chemical name of the co-reactant.

bubblerTemperature.description: Temperature of the co-reactant bubbler in Celsius, if applicable.

radicals.description: Radicals present in the plasma, e.g., O radicals.

reactionProducts.description: Reaction products formed during plasma exposure, e.g., H2O, CO2.

plasmaType.description: Type of plasma used, e.g., remote O2 plasma.

plasmaSource.description: Configuration of the plasma source, e.g., capacitively coupled.

plasmaExposureTime.description: Duration of plasma exposure in seconds.

plasmaPower.description: Power of the plasma in watts.

plasmaProperties.description: Properties of the plasma used in PEALD.

vaporPressure.description: Vapor pressure of the co-reactant in Torr, if applicable.

carrierGas.description: Type of carrier gas used with the reactants.

reactor.description: Name and manufacturer of the reactor used.

reactorDesign.description: Specific design features of the reactor, such as a capacitively coupled plasma source.

reactorType.description: Type of reactor used, e.g., flow-type, showerhead, batch, energy-enhanced, spatial.

temperatureRange.description: Temperature range for the deposition process in Celsius.

chamberPressure.description: Pressure in the reactor during the ALD process in Pascal (Pa).

basePressure.description: Base pressure in the reactor before starting the deposition in Pascal (Pa).

numberOfCycles.description: Total number of ALD cycles to achieve the desired film thickness.

type.description: Type of substrate used in the ALD process, e.g., c-Si, muscovite mica, sapphire.

dopingType.description: Doping type of the substrate, e.g., n-type, p-type.

resistivity.description: Resistivity of the substrate in ohm-cm.

crystallographicOrientation.description: Crystallographic orientation of the substrate, e.g., (001).

surfaceTreatment.description: Surface treatment applied to the substrate before deposition.

seedLayer.description: Material used as a seed layer to facilitate film growth, e.g., iridium.

precursorPulseTime.description: Pulse time for the precursor in seconds.

coReactantPulseTime.description: Pulse time for the co-reactant in seconds.

dosingTimes.description: Dosing times for precursors and co-reactants.

precursorPurgeTime.description: Time for the precursor purge in seconds.

coReactantPurgeTime.description: Time for the co-reactant purge in seconds.

purgeTimes.description: Purge times between precursor and co-reactant pulses.

baseMaterialCycles.description: Number of cycles for the base material in a supercycle.

dopantCycles.description: Number of cycles for the dopant material in a supercycle.

dopingFraction.description: Fraction of dopant cycles in the supercycle.

supercycle.description: Details of the supercycle used for doping.

exposureSequence.description: Sequence of precursor and reactant exposure, e.g., T-S-N*.

gasResidenceTime.description: Gas residence time during the plasma step in seconds.

massChange.description: Mass change observed during QCM analysis in ng/cm².

intensityChanges.description: Description of intensity changes over time.

description.description: Description of Spectroscopic Ellipsometry technique used.

observations.description: Key observations from Spectroscopic Ellipsometry analysis.

description.description: Description of lifetime testing technique used.

roughness.description: Surface roughness measured by AFM in nanometers.

characterizationTechniques.description: Techniques used to monitor the ALD process and their observations.

atmosphere.description: Atmosphere used during annealing, e.g., nitrogen.

duration.description: Duration of the annealing process in minutes.

rapidThermalAnnealing.description: Indicates if rapid thermal annealing (RTA) is used.

annealingConditions.description: Conditions under which the film is annealed post-deposition.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for growth per cycle.

nucleationPeriod.description: Number of cycles for the nucleation period.

selfLimitingGrowth.description: Indicates whether the growth is self-limiting.

epitaxialRelation.description: Epitaxial relationship between the film and the substrate.

domainOrientations.description: Orientations of domains in the epitaxial film.

vanDerWaalsEpitaxy.description: Indicates if van der Waals epitaxy is observed.

material.description: Material of the interlayer, e.g., SiNx.

thickness.description: Thickness of the interlayer in nanometers.

formationMethod.description: Method used for interlayer formation, e.g., plasma exposure.

interlayerFormation.description: Details of interlayer formation during epitaxial growth.

growthMode.description: Growth mode observed during deposition, e.g., Volmer-Weber.

growthMechanism.description: Specific growth mechanism, e.g., double monolayer growth.

redepositionEffect.description: Description of the redeposition effect observed during plasma-assisted ALD.

growthBehavior.description: Growth behavior characteristics including growth per cycle, nucleation period, and self-limiting growth.

chemicalComposition.description: Chemical composition of the deposited film.

stoichiometry.description: Stoichiometry of the film, e.g., O/Hf ratio.

bandgap.description: Optical bandgap of the film in eV.

hydrogen.description: Hydrogen impurity content in atomic percent.

carbon.description: Carbon impurity content in atomic percent.

oxygen.description: Oxygen impurity content in atomic percent.

nitrogen.description: Nitrogen impurity content in atomic percent.

chlorine.description: Chlorine impurity content in atomic percent.

thickness.description: Final thickness of the film in nanometers.

crystallinePhase.description: Crystalline phase of the film, e.g., monoclinic, tetragonal, cubic.

orientation.description: Crystallographic orientation of the film, e.g., (111).

preferentialOrientation.description: Preferential orientation of crystallites in the film.

uniformity.description: Indicates whether the film is uniform across the substrate.

conformality.description: Indicates whether the film conforms to 3D structures, achieving 100% step coverage.

roughness.description: Surface roughness of the film in nanometers.

density.description: Density of the film in g/cm³.

residualStress.description: Residual stress in the film in MPa.

resistivity.description: Resistivity of the film in ohm-cm.

domainSize.description: Average domain size in the film in nanometers.

resistivity.description: Electrical resistivity of the film in ohm-meter.

carrierDensity.description: Carrier density in the film, typically measured in cm⁻³.

mobility.description: Carrier mobility in the film, typically measured in cm²/Vs.

bandgap.description: Electronic bandgap of the film in eV.

seebeckCoefficient.description: Seebeck coefficient of the film in µV/K.

thermalConductivity.description: Thermal conductivity of the film in W/mK.

ionicConductivity.description: Ionic conductivity of the film in S/cm.

hygroscopicity.description: Indicates if the film is hygroscopic.

wetEtchRate.description: Wet-etch rate of the film in nm/min.

chemicalSafety.description: Safety considerations for the chemicals used.

filmStability.description: Stability of the film under various conditions.

reproducibility.description: Indicates whether the ALD process is reproducible.

lithiumSource.description: Source of lithium used for intercalation, e.g., LiOtBu.

intercalationCycles.description: Number of cycles used for lithium intercalation.

intercalationTemperature.description: Temperature during lithium intercalation in Celsius.

intercalationDepth.description: Depth of lithium intercalation in nanometers.

intercalation.description: Details of the intercalation process, particularly for lithium-ion battery applications.

chemisorption.description: Description of the chemisorption step, e.g., bifunctional binding of AlCH3.

oxidation.description: Description of the oxidation step, e.g., combustion-like reactions with O radicals.

secondaryReactions.description: Description of any secondary reactions, e.g., thermal ALD-like reactions induced by byproducts.

reactionMechanisms.description: Details of the reaction mechanisms during the ALD process.

passivationTechnique.description: Technique used for surface passivation, e.g., in situ H2S passivation.

passivationDuration.description: Duration of the passivation process in minutes.

effectiveSurfaceRecombinationVelocity.description: Effective surface recombination velocity in cm/s.

surfacePassivation.description: Properties related to surface passivation of the substrate.

items.description: Components of the heterostructure, e.g., MoS2, TiO2.

bandAlignment.description: Type of band alignment in the heterostructure, e.g., type II.

heterostructures.description: Details about heterostructures formed during the ALD process.

atmosphere.description: Atmosphere used during sulfurization, e.g., H2S.

sulfurization.description: Details of the sulfurization process to improve film crystallinity.

postDepositionTreatment.description: Post-deposition treatments applied to the film.

failureTemperature.description: Temperature at which the diffusion barrier fails in Celsius.

barrierMaterial.description: Material used for the diffusion barrier, e.g., TiN, TaN, Ti-Si-N.

microstructure.description: Microstructure of the diffusion barrier, e.g., nanocrystalline, amorphous.

diffusionBarrierProperties.description: Properties related to diffusion barriers in ALD processes.

plasmaPower.description: Power of the plasma used in the reactor in watts.

gasMixture.description: Gas mixture used in the reactor, e.g., H2-N2.

reactorDetails.description: Details about the reactor configuration and conditions.

plasmaGasComposition.description: Composition of the plasma gas used, e.g., H2, H2-N2, NH3.

plasmaExposureTime.description: Duration of plasma exposure in seconds.

description.description: Description of spectroscopic ellipsometry used for in situ monitoring.

observations.description: Key observations from in situ spectroscopic ellipsometry.

description.description: Description of optical emission spectroscopy used for in situ monitoring.

observations.description: Key observations from in situ optical emission spectroscopy.

intensityChanges.description: Description of intensity changes over time.

inSituDiagnostics.description: In situ diagnostics used to monitor the ALD process.

waterContactAngle.description: Water contact angle of the film in degrees.

surfaceFreeEnergy.description: Surface free energy of the film in J/m².

postAnnealingContactAngle.description: Water contact angle after annealing in degrees.

annealingEffects.description: Effects of annealing on the film's wettability.

wettability.description: Properties related to the wettability of the film.

decomposition.description: Indicates if decomposition of precursors occurs, leading to a CVD component.

etching.description: Indicates if etching of the substrate or film occurs due to reaction products.

surfacePoisoning.description: Indicates if reaction products compete with precursors for surface sites, affecting growth.

chemicalSideEffects.description: Potential chemical side effects impacting the ALD process.

capacity.description: Electrochemical capacity of the film in mAh/g.

voltageRange.description: Voltage range for electrochemical testing in volts.

cycleLife.description: Number of cycles the film can undergo before significant degradation.

electrochemicalCharacterization.description: Electrochemical performance metrics for battery applications.

metalType.description: Type of noble metal deposited, e.g., platinum, ruthenium, palladium.

lowTemperatureLimit.description: Lowest temperature at which deposition is effective for the noble metal in Celsius.

seedLayerEffect.description: Description of the effect of seed layers on deposition, e.g., catalytic activation.

oxygenSource.description: Source of oxygen used in the process, e.g., pure oxygen, air.

nobleMetalDeposition.description: Details specific to the deposition of noble metals.

dielectricLoss.description: Dielectric loss tangent of the film.

polarization.description: Polarization of the film in µC/cm².

coerciveField.description: Coercive field of the film in MV/cm.
